refnamediv.refpurpose: Reads image file in any format

varlistentry.listitem: A string, the image filename to be read. The extension determines the type of the image.
For truecolor images, this is a MxNx3 matrix in range 0-1 (double precision); For binary images, image is a MxNx1 matrix (0=black and 1=white).
Mx3 matrix containing the image colormap. Entries range from 0 to 1 (double precision).

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: imread reads BMP, GIF, JPEG, PNG, PCX, TIFF, XPM, and many more types of image files into Scilab. The format of the file is inferred from the extension in the filename parameter.

varlistentry.listitem: reads image in filename into Img matrix. If filename contains a truecolor image, Img is a MxNx3 hypermatrix, so for example Img(:,:,1) stands for the red channel. For gray images, im is a MxNx1 matrix.
reads the indexed image in filename into Index (MxN) and Map (Mx3), its colormap. Grayscale and Paleliteraled images are read in this way.

refsection.para: To know if the image stored in filename is truecolor or indexed, you can use the imfinfo command, and then call imread accordingly.
